src:
US extends divestiture deadline for sanctioned Russian firm GAZ

02 Nov 2019, 03:00

The U.S. Treasury said on Friday it was giving investors several more months to divest from Russian automaker GAZ , a company linked to Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska that Washington sanctioned over Russia's "malign activity."
WASHINGTON: The U.S. Treasury said on Friday it was giving investors several more months to divest from Russian automaker GAZ , a company linked to Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska that Washington sanctioned over Russia's "malign activity."
The U.S. Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control said it would allow investors and businesses until March 31 to cut ties with GAZ. It also said it would permit activities needed to maintain or wind down existing contracts with GAZ until then.
Advertisement
Advertisement
The previous deadlines were November 8.
(Reporting by Tim Ahmann; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
Source: Reuters

US extends divestiture deadline for sanctioned Russian firm GAZ

02 Nov 2019, 03:00

The U.S. Treasury said on Friday it was giving investors several more months to divest from Russian automaker GAZ , a company linked to Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska that Washington sanctioned over Russia's "malign activity."
WASHINGTON: The U.S. Treasury said on Friday it was giving investors several more months to divest from Russian automaker GAZ , a company linked to Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska that Washington sanctioned over Russia's "malign activity."
The U.S. Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control said it would allow investors and businesses until March 31 to cut ties with GAZ. It also said it would permit activities needed to maintain or wind down existing contracts with GAZ until then.
